intro: Achaetogeron subacaulis, commonly known as the slender moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, acrocarpous moss that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. The plant has a delicate, creeping growth habit with short, upright stems and closely spaced leaves. Its leaves are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape and have a smooth, glossy surface. Achaetogeron subacaulis plays a minor but important role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
